member.param: A function that returns true if and only if the actual number of calls that happened is the desired amount.

member.name: M:FakeItEasy.Creation.IFakeObjectCreator.CreateFakeWithoutLoopDetection(System.Type,FakeItEasy.Creation.IProxyOptions,FakeItEasy.Creation.IDummyValueResolver,FakeItEasy.Creation.LoopDetectingResolutionContext)
member.summary: Create a fake, without first checking to see if the indicates that we're already trying to create a fake .

remarks.para: Normal type resolution loop detection is avoided only for this attempt to create . Loop detection is still on for any constructor parameters required to make the fake, even if they are of type typeOfFake (or if those parameters in turn require a typeOfFake and so on).

This method should only be used when it is known that attempting to create a fake typeOfFake will not in and of itself introduce a loop, for example when creating a fake that is to be used as a dummy, the checks that it's safe to make a fake before using to do so.

member.param: The type of the fake.
Proxy options to be used when creating the fake.
Will be used to create dummy constructor arguments, if needed.
Used to detect loops in the type resolution.
member.returns: A CreationResult that contains the fake or indicates the reason for failure.

remarks.para: Note that this method might be called when the fake is not yet fully constructed, so should use the fake instance to set up behavior, but not rely on the instance's state. member.name: T:FakeItEasy.IBootstrapper
member.summary: Bootstrapper for FakeItEasy.

remarks.para: When FakeItEasy is initialized, it scans the executing app domain for implementations of this interface. If any are found, one will be instantiated and used to bootstrap FakeItEasy. If no implementations are found, then a will be used.
The recommended way to implement IBootstrapper is to extend DefaultBootstrapper and override selected methods.

member.summary: Indicates precedence between otherwise indistinguishable options, for example when deciding which should be used to create a Dummy of a given type. In making such decisions, the higher-valued Priority will be used.

member.summary: Gets the default Priority used by client-supplied s, s, and s.
member.remarks: Equivalent to a Priority with value 0.

member.name: P:FakeItEasy.Priority.Internal
member.summary: Gets the Priority used by all FakeItEasy-supplied s, s, and s.

remarks.para: Equivalent to a Priority with value -1.

We have a single such Priority because it's all that's currently needed, and we're unlikely to introduce built-in dummy factories, fake options builders, or argument value formatters that would collide with one another. Just in case, though, all negative values have been reserved for use by FakeItEasy.

member.name: M:FakeItEasy.Priority.CompareTo(FakeItEasy.Priority)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.returns:
A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings:
less than zero: this instance precedes in the sort order
zero: this instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as
greater than zero: this instance follows in the sort order
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
